english: to pull; to lead; to involve; to drag

etymology.description: phonetic 玄 + semantic 牛 (“cow, ox”); depicts leading an ox by hand.
etymology.interpretation: Sound is borrowed from 玄, while 牛 anchors the meaning in cattle and the act of pulling or leading. In the traditional form, a 手 element underscores the idea of guiding an ox by hand, matching senses like “to pull/lead.”
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 牽 by omitting the bottom 手 component and compressing the remaining parts, reducing strokes while retaining phonetic 玄 and semantic 牛.

examples.chinese: 他牵着孩子过马路(他牽著孩子過馬路)。
examples.english: He leads the child across the street.

examples.chinese: 这件事牵涉到很多人(這件事牽涉到很多人)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn shì qiānshè dào hěn duō rén.

examples.chinese: 她牵着狗散步(她牽著狗散步)。
examples.english: She walks the dog on a leash.
